title: Holt Renfrew display signage italic
content:
I'm looking for the italic in this image:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317154626im_/http:/typophile.com/files/10968360_10153153268844548_1947011402436012427_n_4923.jpg)

I'm not sure if it's related to the roman caps above it, but it could be.

I've found a few things that are close, but nothing that quite matches. Most things I've found have double-storey 'g', and I haven't been able to find anything like the 'v' or 'w'.

Thanks!

Font: 

 Chronicle Display 

Solved By: 

 [riccard0](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317154626/http:/typophile.com/user/46071 "View user profile.")
author: fission

comments.content:
Chronicle Display: [http://www.typography.com/fonts/chronicle-display/overview/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317154626/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/chronicle-display/overview/ "http://www.typography.com/fonts/chronicle-display/overview/")

(and, yes, it’s the same as the Roman capitals)
